Name: LANTUS

Sideffects: The only side effects I expirence is burning during injection and it doesn't happen with every dose. It just happens time to time.
Comments: Lantus has been an amazing drug for me. It has effectively lowered my high blood sugar to normal levels! I was struggling with very high sugar from 200 to300 range before lantus. It works so well for me my levels are that of a person without diabetes now. Once you find the dose that's right for you its amazing how effective lantus is! I really like the fact that lantus doesn't peak like other insulins so I don't get unwanted lows while taking lantus! Just one shot a day covers me all day! I'm on a sliding scale of humulin but rarely have to take it because lantus does such a great job! I truely recomend lantus to all who are struggling with high blood sugar. The side effects are so minimumal its really a great drug. I use lantus in the solostar pen and its sooo. Easy to use. The small needle is so painless and the pen is so nice it can be taken anywhere and it looks like a regular marking pen! Its soo convienant. So much easier than vials and syringes! With lantus, once you find the dose correct for you, its a God send! Don't give up just do some trials with your doctor to find your dose and once you do, your sugar will run normal again with lantus! I can not stress enough how well this drug has been doing for me! No more struggle with high numbers for me! I think the most important thing to remember is be patient because it does take a little time to find the correct dose for your bodys needs. Once you find that dose, you will be amazed on how well lantus works! I am very gr
Name: LANTUS

Sideffects: The only thing I had to get use to was eating right after taking it otherwise I have no other problems except burning when needle is injected incorrectly.
Name: LANTUS

Sideffects:
The skin on my face, neck, chest and arms turned red. Hair falling out. Weight gain due to  
Enshasabl appetite. I use to eat 3 meals a day with no snacking and now I can't stop eating. I am forgetting thing as I am talking
And the worst thing is uncontrollable muscle spasms.  On my right calf. Almost 7 years I had yo have right foot removed due you Charcot Foot. When I woke up I was having the spasms and have been ever since. At time I have to be hospitalised. I have bad swilling in legs and hands. I fight constipation and loose stools. I get bad headache.  I think the lantis is the problem m

.
Name: LANTUS

Sideffects: Weard dreams,cramping in hands, neuromotor malfunction in fingers
Comments: Posion has 2.7 mg of cresol (LYSOL) per 10ml vial look up side effects of cresol lots of neurological problems
Name: LANTUS

Sideffects: weight gain
Comments: The insulin has helped reduce blood sugar, but it must change your metabolism. Unfortunately the weight gain has caused my bloodsugar to increase, but it's still lower than without using it. For the person who said the injection site stings - you need to wait until the alcohol is completely dry before injecting.
Name: LANTUS

Sideffects: When taking Lantus in conjunction with Humalog insulin, be more cautious of low blood sugar reactions.
Comments: Thi insulin provides an excellent, long-lasting basal dose of insulin.  It is convienently taken once a day, at bedtime.  However,some users may not get adequate control with one dose daily and must split their insulin dose to a twice-a-day schedule.  It's like the pump in the way you receive constant coverage.  It has helped this brittle diabetic lower her HgA1C to an 8!  Hooray!  My neuropathy and blurry vision have also improved.  If your internist recommends Lantus definately give it a try.
Name: LANTUS

Sideffects: After a while, nausea subsides. Constipated at times and believed to be caused by this medication. Occasionally will have slight discomfort (not pain) in my right side which I will tell my doctor next visit. Works well for me.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: After four months and moving from 1.2 to 1.8 vomitted and irregular stool pattern--more frequent toilet visits.  I have been fatigued with headaches.
Comments: Lost 30 lbs. in four months and BMI lowered from 39 to 33.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: After injection I can taste the medicine in my throat. Had a light headache on the first few weeks but went away.
Comments: Over the past 6 weeks I've lost 15 pounds. I do not have any urge to snack. I have to remind myself to eat. I also don't eat much. Medicine works very well for me.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects:
At .6 dosage had slight headache and mild nausea..totally tolerable
At 1.2 dosage have gas, fould smelling belching, noisy stomach and rotten breath.  I know this slows down the absorbtion of food in the stomach but I feel like the food is just laying there rottening. I am still having morning lows in the 70s but my bed time numbers have come down to low 100's compared to low 200s.
Comments: I will try to stick this out for a couple more weeks as other posts have mentioned the symptoms lessening and I would love to have some weight loss.  If they don't then I will have to stop this drug.  The foul smell and rumbling stomach is really embarrassing!
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: At 0.6 I did not experience any noticeable problems. Lost a few pound. Was increased to 1.8 and taken off Lantus. Appetite decreased. Developed pain in rib cage. Low blood sugar levels, fatigue, dizziness. Decreased to 1.2. Rib cage pain is worse as time goes on, Shortness of breath when trying to sleep, loss of sleep, Dry mouth in the early morning hours while trying to sleep. Blood sugar has come back up to 140-160. Rash has developed,  Thought it may be shingles but not the case, pain going around sides toward back, still very tired, neck pain, shoulder pain is starting to develop, and have a strong burning pain across my abdomen and on both sides of it. Feels like my insides are cooking.
Comments: I had just gone into see my doctor on Tuesday. I am going back today and demanding they take me off of this medication before these symptoms get any worse. I would only use this as a last resort . It will help you lose some weight, but that isn't a good reason to use it. Rapid weight loss can also be a precursor to cancer, so maybe it's not something to feel that great about. All I know is, my body is telling me not to use it anymore and that's good enough for me. Good luck. If I find out I have pancreatitis or worse I will let you know.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: At first I had headache but those went away with time, maybe a month. I lost 30 lbs in the first 3 months of taking and my A1C came down 3 points.
Comments: The only complaint I have is the cost! HOLY COW!
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: At first it worked great for reducing appetite and sugars. Very dry mouth, bad taste, and nausea. HOWEVER, developed excruciating upper abdominal pain relieved by leaning forward (definately pancreatitis). Can no longer take the drug and now my pancreas is fried, as I have lost control over my sugars. A1Cs were always in the 5-6 range before Victoza. Now I have to take TWICE the humalog and Lantus I ever did.
Comments: I am afraid this drug has seriously damaged my pancreas. I do NOT recommend this drug.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Bad diarrhea when starting to use medication.  Daily stomach cramps and fatigue.  Intense throat / lung cold 3 weeks into treatment (may not be related).  Ended with intense nausea, vomiting and dry heaves.
Comments:
Stopped using Victoza.  Do not use this product.

Further research revealed increased cancer risk.  Going to have a stern talk with the prescribing doctor about this.
http://www.diabetesmine.com/2011/06/newsflash-fda-issues-warning-on-victoza.html
http://www.youhavealawyer.com/blog/2012/04/20/victoza-recall-lawsuit/
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Bad upset stomach from the morning of the 2nd day. On 3rd day seem to be easing up. Blood sugar level was the same on 8mmol/l the 2nd day but dropped to 7.5mmol/l the 3rd day. I guess it is still very early days and got to get over the side effects however hope this will not be a recurring thing as I hate having an upset stomach. I have heard and read great reports from using Victoza including from my doctor and phamacist. Looking forward to the results for reduction in blood glucost level but especially in weight loss. Main aim for weight loss is due to sleep apnea.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Blurred vision, insomnia, itchy
Comments: Loved that it reduced my appetite and I lost 5 lbs in the first week.  However I can not deal with the blurred vision.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Burping. Fatigue is getting worse. Nausea and abdominal discomfort not bad now.
Comments:
Lost 10 lbs in the first 3 weeks with some discomfort and mood swings.  .
Fatigue is getting worse. I might have to quit. Doc says exercise and eat better. Hope it works. So far it was worth it just for the 10 lbs
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Caused my husband 46,to have necrotizing pancreatitis with multiorgan failure.he almost died twice and is still very sick.he took victoza for over a year. Do not take this drug
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Constipation
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Constipation, eggy burps, nausea, indigestion, vomiting, stomach cramps
Comments:
In the first few weeks, my appetite shut down completely and so did my cravings. Blood sugar dropped below 100 after about 2 weeks. The only side effect I experienced was constipation which was manageable. I attribute any weight loss to eating a proper caloric deficit, which I was already doing before the medication.

About 6 weeks in I started to experience the foul burps, then within 3 days I was constantly nauseous, vomiting, cramping, and still constipated. None of my food was getting processed.

It's warm and fuzzy at first, then it bites you hard. Never touching this stuff again, praying I haven't done any lasting damage by taking it.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Constipation, nausea
Comments: I have used Victoza off and on for 3 years, but finally consistently the last 6 months. I had to stop all the other times because I felt so horrible with nausea, vomiting, etc. This time I decided to take it at bedtime instead of morning, and WOW big difference. I also started really low and only went up on the dose when I no longer had any side effects (other than constipation). I really can't take any more than five clicks beyond 1.2, so that's what I do. I have lost more than 50#, got off insulin, and dropped my A1c from 8.4 to 5.1. I wouldn't attribute it all to Victoza, because I have done the hard work, but it makes me feel full and that is a big help in reducing intake and managing my blood sugars.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Debilitating nausea, vomiting, extreme fatigue. I had a Lap Band, and thought that my symptoms were from that, so eventually I had the Lap Band removed. In the recovery phase from removing the Lap Band, the symptoms intensified greatly. Food made me very nauseated, and I could hardly make it through a day at work.  Then I ran out of the needles for injecting Victoza, and the next day I was much better.  Got needles, took Victoza and the following day I was back to feeling rotten.  So I stayed off the Victoza over the weekend, again felt much better.  Saw MD, switched to another antidiabetic medication and have had no further symptoms!
Comments: Victoza, along with Metformin and diet, exercise, did help keep my HbA1c lower, and I was blaming the nausea and often vomiting on the lap band.  I did lose some weight while taking the Victoza, but at the cost of being completely miserable most of the time.  I wonder if I would have needed to have the lap band removed had I discovered this adverse effect of the Victoza sooner?  I guess I will never know.  I would like to emphasize that for me, the nausea and fatigue were not just annoying, they were life altering.  The side effects were often debilitating, and once I stopped taking the Victoza, the relief was amazing.  I realize that the company might say that it was the Lap Band causing the side effects, and that is what I thought, and why I had it removed.  But the symptoms continued unabated, in fact worsened as I was recovering from the surgery, and did not abate until I stopped taking the Victoza.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Diagnosed Severe Pancreatitis and he stopped the Victoza injections immediately.   Started out with a lot of burping, then diarrhea, nausea vomiting.  Like others, food would not digest, just sit in my stomach and rot until I threw up.  Had to get anti-nausea meds so my body could be fed.
Comments: The product worked well and I did lose weight.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: diarhrrea, stomachache.  weight loss   5 lbs in 1 week. : )
Name: VICTOZA

Reason: Lower blood sugar and lose weight
Sideffects: did have a bit f nausea and vomiting
Comments:
Well sadly did not lose any weight on the drug
I would like to know why
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Dizzy, Nausea, stomach cramps and headaches
Comments: Couldn't keep food down, felt weak flu symptoms. Felt okay until after 3 months of taking it. After 7 months I lost the weight and stopped taking the drug, then the symptoms started up again. Went to the doctor because I couldn't keep any food down, I was diagnosed with stage 3 Stomach cancer! No one in family has ever had cancer, this med is POISON!
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG.. IT IS A POISON TO YOUR BODY. It is most possibly the worst drug ever.  Yes I lost weight and my A1C was lower but I had to undergo $100,000 worth of testing after I took this drug. It completely messed up my body and is so not worth it. Being in the hospital because of a drug is not ok. The people who have only been on it for 5-10 days and are commenting should not be able to. Yes, I too was fine for the first two weeks. Just wait you will feel like death soon and your body will not be able to function.  It is a very harmful drug that should not be allowed on the market.  Please listen to your body!!
Comments: DO NOT TAKE THIS POISON
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects:
Dry mouth is the most predominant side effect... No headache
I LOVE NOT HAVING THE SUGAR CARBOHYDRATE CRAVINGS.

When I increased the dose on day 7, to .9
I got diarrhea and nausea -- I'm going to try to stay below .9 as long as I can.
From reading posts here it seems like the appetite and cravings return after a few weeks.
Comments:
Taking the shot 15 minutes before a light well rounded breakfast with PROTEIN works best for me. Staying hydrated is a must-- seems to keep the nausea away.

I'm also taking a fiber capsule daily and probiotic
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Extreme abdominal pain front left and both kidneys hurt in my back. Two months of constant diarrhea.
Comments: It will make you lose weight and bring your numbers down. I dropped three pant sizes. I was happy the first 7 months. By the 7th month the pain set in. The 8th month I quit it. I'm speculating it has caused me pancreas and kidney damage. I'll find out in a couple weeks when I go to the doctors. If you have high cholesterol means you don't have the best pancreas to begin with. I've lost 84 lbs but at what cost?
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Extreme nausea and vomiting, although it sure cut down on my appetite. Exhaustion from being sick 24 hours a day.
Comments: I don't know how anyone can hold a job taking this medication if they experience the same side effects that I did. I would just spontaneously throw up in my office at work. Then I would be exhausted.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Extreme nausea, diarerhea, stomach pain, general aches and pains, lost 11 pounds in 10 days
Comments: The side effects became more severe as time progressed, I found myself so sick, I didn't want to get out of bed, even slight movement made the nausea worse.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Fast heartbeat - tachycardia
Comments: Had to stop this drug and go back to Byetta.  Heart rate was too fast.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Fatigue, malaise, no loss of appetite, leg pain, no reduction in BG levels, headaches, nausea.
Comments: Doesn't work for me at all.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Fatigue, nausea,  severe headaches,unable to do daily work, cramps, diarrhea.
Comments: Why on earth would the FDA approve a drug that causes CANCER in rats and mice?  And, even more puzzling, why would a physician prescribe a druge that causes CANCER?
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Fatigue, weakness
Comments: Works for weight losss. however I think there has to be a better way. Quality of life is more important
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: felling fat round middle not hungrey bloated and  eyes were playing up
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: First week I felt a lot of fatigue. But after that things are perfect.  I have lost 29 pounds in 6 weeks. No appetite. No sugar cravings. Overall fabulous drug!
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: First week I started taking it major headaches, extreme nausea and extremely fatigued, severe depression. Lost 15lbs in ONE WEEK! Had to stop taking it for two weeks (unfortunately gained the weight back) then tried it again. So this time I have loss of appetite and some nausea but nothing major but I've had a headache for a week and nothing will take it away. I have lost 12lbs in two weeks but I'm going to stop taking it again because of this headache I can't get rid of. I guess that's what I get for trying to lose weight the easy way :(
Comments: If you're taking this just to lose weight, don't use this. The whole point of losing weight is to be and feel healthy and I just do not feel healthy anymore being on this medication.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: First week on .6ml, dizzy one day, diarrhea 2 days, upset stomach 2 days.  None of these affect occured at the same time.  So, basically I was having some kind of a problem for 5 days in the first week.
Comments:
Endo, put me on Victoza as A1C was 7.3.  He prescribed .6 for 1 week, 1.2 for 2 weeks then onto 1.8.  I never dialed up to 1.2 as I didn't want to get sick again after the first week.  I gradually dialed an extra click past .6 over a 3 week period to avoid some of the problems.  I did -- I stop with only 5 clicks past .6 --- bacically it's 1/2 between .6 and 1.2 or .9.  This is where I've been.  A1C is now 6.4.  Lost 10 lbs. the first week, gained back 8. Probably from not eating from being sick. With summer being here I will be more active -- hopefully I'll be able to lose more weight -- this will help to low my A1C. 

I've been very pleased with Victoza -- except for the cost.  The drug has helpped me to control my diabeties.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Got very ill.Dr took blood n my lipase and amylase numbers off the chart.He said i had acute pancreatitis.Iwill never take this drug again
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Have indigestion but not bad.  When I raised the dosage to 1.2 I started having stomach cramping and diarrhea.  I have called Victoza and they are clueless.  They are of no help.  They claim they have not studied people that have diarrhea and therefore have no info about it.  Victoza is not working alone for me but along with my insulin I do have good sugars but the side effects to me are not worth it.
Comments: Not impressed with the company and no one seems to want to try to talk to you.  They are paying a lot of people for nothing.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Have to manage nausea almost every day.  No vomiting.  Fatigue and much slower athletic performance -- swimming -- about ten seconds slower per hundred.
Comments: My doctor has advised me to skip a day here and there to manage symptoms.  Also to decrease dosage.  I am now trying 1.2.  I have lost about ten pounds.  I am pleased that I have had some weight loss, so I am willing to suffer to lose more.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Having diarrhea and sometimes reflux. So far, love the side effect of nonappetite.
Comments: As a healthcare professional I have done a lot of research about Victoza and how it works. Think it can help patients in many ways but obviously everyone is different and some may not tolerate this.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Headache in eyes and sinus. Loss of energy. Sweating cold sweating ckammy. No appetite. Feel just plain old horrible. How long till this is out of my system?
Comments: Will I ever feel good again?
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: headache, naesua, sore throat
Comments: seems to help with appetite control, rarely even hungry now! sugars are definately lower than they have been in years.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Headaches
Comments: Dropped 19 pounds in 27 days,, Headaches daily now .Great appetite supressant
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Headaches, Rt side pain, no energy, heart racing
Name: VICTOZA

Reason: To lower glucose and to lose weight
Sideffects: Headaches,swelling of the stomach,bruising in injection area, extreme fatique,very sensitive,
Comments: I did not like the way I was feeling so I stopped. Did not lose any weight. Before starting Victoza my glucose level was a little high but I don't have diabetes. Now that I stopped (2weeks) my glucose levels are staying way too high. My stomach is feeling a lot better but now I am so worried about my glucose levels. :(
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: headaches; wicked abdominal pain; N/D; some weight loss; sugars are the best they've been in years.  I need to figure out if the side effects are worth the EXCRUCIATING pain!
Comments: I REALLY hope I can stick with this.  It's the first thing that's worked for me in years.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I also now have a brain tumor...Unknown if it could be related.  The up side is it is not malignant.  a1c was very good though.  Now that I have not taken it for about 3 weeks all the pain and headaches and upset stomach and reflux have gone...
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects:
I am an IDDM person. I use humulinRu-500 insulin. I am very, very insulin resistant. I also can not walk due to arthritis.I need to loose some weight.So far I have lost 11 pounds.
Nausea- injected just before eating; solved problem.
Throat burn (not really heart burn)- working on this...
Comments: I would welcome help with this. Or any ideas on how to help it work better.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I am having side effects like eggy burps nausea acid stomach diarrhea and bad sore throat. I am going to try to stick to it because it has brought my bs done and controlled.  Also insulin has made me gain 30 pounds which exasperate the problem.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I am very sleepy. I burp a lot. My body hurts in my joints. My nose runs and I have a slighy head pounding. Good thing is that I am not hungry. But not much energy  to exercise.  About 14 hours after I take the shot I start to feel better. I am on the lowest dose now... How can I even consider going  up on it next week?  How long will this last????
Comments: So very expensive. Do not know if I can continue with it.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I developed severe stomach pain followed by nausea and then vomiting and diarrhea at the same time.  The rest of the time I would have severe constipation.  The palms of my hands would become very red, my mouth would get very dry and I could feel the ridges in the top of my mouth. My first episode began on the third day of taking the Victoza, and I had approx. 1 episode a week until I stopped taking it.
Comments: My first episode required a visit to the ER and another visit  the paramedics were called. That was the first time I had ever been to an ER or had the paramedics called. Subsequent episodes would leave me unable to work the rest of the day.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I did fine at .6 mg and really had very little nausea and dropped 3 IBs the first week. Then it came time to increase to 1.2 mg a day. I burped constantly and had this pressure in my stomach most of the time. I switched and started taking it at night and that improved greatly. I however have developed insomnia with it. I have lost 12 IBS in a month, but don't sleep well. I may try taking it in the morning again. My BS are much improved.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I did well until four weeks ago and developed a very sore throat and bronchitis. I had taken it for two months with no problems . I took antibiotics  and it helped a little and then things got worse. I looked up side effects and says sore throat,, upper respiratory infection , and bronchitis. My doc didn't think that the Victoza was the cause.. I insisted on going  off the Victoa and the symptoms disappeared in three days. I may try it again but not until feeling well again
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I had horrible continuous nausea with some vomiting. Almost continual diarrhea. Horrible metallic taste in mouth which is still lingering even after being off almost a month. Terrible indigestion and sour stomach. The sour stomach is also lingering. I couldn't eat correctly. I ended up eating soft carbs because my stomach was so sour. I couldn't drink water so I was getting dehydrated. My sugars were great but I wasnt losing weight. I finally decided I'd had enough and stopped it.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I had only taken 1 dose in the am and later in the evening experienced nausea.
Comments: I am very concerned about the information of victoza that it can cause thyroid tumors and cancer what the insert has said about this medication tested on mice. However, it said its still unknown about its  effects on human studys, but clearly states it can cause pancreatic problems in humans. I beleive even though the FDA has approved this drug, i think its not safe to take this drug yet because of those risks involved. Sorry FDA, but i have quit taking this drug after i have read this information.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I had Some nausea, vomiting and upset stomach for about 3-4 days when first starting and each new level of dose.  I lost 24 pounds in the first month and my fasting numbers were between 94-115 on the 1st week. When I went up to the 1.2 fasting was 88-98 and I pretty much stay in those numbers all day. I tried moving up to 1.8 but the side effects mentioned above were just too much to handle with no real change in numbers that were already fantastic! I'm back at the 1.2, I'm still losing about 1-2 lbs a week and am very pleased. I do however have the unpleasant injection site rash every now and then, but it is much less frequently using the 8mm needles instead of the 6mm.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I have had nausea, stomach bloating, severe diarrhea accompanied with a rotten egg burp.
Comments: I have been off VICTOZA for four weeks now and I am having these same issues every other day. Sometimes it may give me a three day break but so far it has been persistent
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I tried this along with metformin and with in 2 day was very sick. Had really bad burping,could not eat anything, food did not digest at all and then started vomiting. I did stop it when I found out the same week I  needed my gallbladder out. Did retry this and I was even sicker With vomiting and diarrhea. I can not wait for this to get out of my system I don't know how long that will take.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: I was eager to try this medication to help my blood sugar in use with my metformin and lantus but was more eager because I heard it helps you lose weight. Well I've lost 44lbs and I yes that's a wonderful thing but the horrible side effects that got me there is almost not worth it. Nausea, vomiting, no appetite, and now I think extreme dizziness. Even had to go to er. Gotta talk to my endocrinologist asap BC I am getting to the point of almost passing out. I thought it may have been a different medication but it seems to be the victoza.
Comments: Victoza has multiple side effects which affect some people more than others. Just wanna let y'all who experience bad side effects that you are not alone and if its really bothersome then maybe you should really get on something different
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Initially nausea but I found if I gave the injection and then ate breakfast within 10 minutes, it was much better. Since then just random bouts of nausea when I go too long without eating. At the end of my second week, I started getting extremely bad diarrhea . It would happen shortly after eating. And usually 2-3 times after a meal. That equals 10 or so bouts a day.
Comments: So far I'm very happy. It's not an easy drug to get started on. But I stuck with it through the first week and it has been very tolerable the second week. My blood sugars have dropped significantly. Back in to the 90-110 range 2 hours after eating. I am on 2,000 mg of metformin and 5mg of glipizide twice a day. But I suspect that as I continue to lose weight and eat better, those will be able to be eliminated. So far I've lot 10 lbs in two weeks. My appetite is very mild, bordering on not interested in eating. Without even trying, I am eating 1/4 of the amount of food I usually eat in a day. And I'm feel full all day long!!!! It took a week to get my energy back. I realized right away that if I'm eating a small amount of food it is more important to eat nutrient-dense food and my energy has rebounded. My only hurdle now is to figure out how to stop diarrhea. I am going to start with greek yogurt in the mornings and some probiotics as people have suggested here. It is tough to get started but I believe I'm past the worst of the bad symptoms and it's been very tolerable this last week.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Initially started on o.6 mg, then after 2 weeks went to 1.2 mg.  Also started on Metformin, 2000 mg a day.  I was confined to home with diarrhea 3-4 times per day; however, after consulting with my doctor, it was the high dose of Metformin, so went down to 1000 mg and the diarrhea cleared up.  I do however, have terrible dry mouth at night; I think using the CPAP machine does not help.  I am going to go back down to 0.6 mg and see how I do on that.  The dry mouth is so bad my tongue is literally stuck to the top of my mouth, and my lips stuck to my gums.  It's awful.   However, on a positive note, I've lost 25 pounds.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Intestinal cramps, lower back pain, major changes in toileting routine
Comments: I took this med for about 45 days. Doc wanted me to take for weight loss and glucose control. Never did make it to the 1.8 dosage. The intestinal cramps would wake me up at night, not to mention the changes in my toileting routine were hard to tolerate. Lower back pain was excruciating. Have been off the med now for two to three weeks and side effects have stopped.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Ive read all the reviews on this site before I started the medication.So all the ones who give the bad reviews on VICTOZA,I SMH BECAUSE WHAT PEOPLE FAIL TO REALIZE IS THAT WHEN YOU DONT FOLLOW DIRECTIONS, YOU WILL GET SYMPTOMS!!! Duh!! My diet has been the same except I began adding more Protein so what I eat was never a issue.I began Invokana which I love to help with A1c.That came down 7.4 from a 9.2 within 3 months. First week on Invokana I lost 6lbs but thats it! My weight went up. So Im 280 lbs now. All Im worried about is the fat.I started Victoza this past Thursday. I took it before I went to bed. About 20min later I became extremely sleepy and gasy. Friday I took it in morning, same sleepiness/gasiness. Saturday upped my dose to 1.2 as per Dr.Only thing I have is the sleepiness thats it! I can tell Im losing , just dont know the lbs yet. Ill weigh myself monthly.
Comments: I will see how i do and will update my progress periodically on my weightloss.
Name: VICTOZA

Name: VICTOZA

Name: VICTOZA

Comments: Pros: Lost 15 lbs and had no appetite at all. Fasting sugars were initially much lower (80ish), but returned to more typical range (95+) after several weeks. Cons: Fatigue, dry mouth, bad taste in mouth all day. Caused bad heartburn (never had before) and esophageal spasms (ended up in hospital for the chest pain from the spasms). Will stop taking for several weeks for symptoms to clear up and may start again at a lower dose.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Loss of appetite,headache,burping,general unwell feeling,facial tenderness,cough, pressure and bloating.

Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Lots of abdominal pain, thought it was my gall bladder and after lots of tests found out it is not. Now have started the very bad sour tasting belching, diarrhea, that will be followed by severe throwing up. Notice if I am stressed it gets worse. I can't stand the burping and the gas. Was going to have more tests ran until after reading all the comments on here. Plus I have no energy at all. I took it for awhile in the past and never had this kind of problem. But now it is getting intolerable.
Comments: I was loving it until I have been getting so sick. I thought I kept catching the stomach bug going around. I am going to lay off a few days and see what happens. I have noticed that if I eat raw veggies, fruits and a small piece of chicken, and very small helpings the symptoms go away. But it also makes my blood sugar drop as well. I have lost nearly 60 pounds on this and love that. But hate how I feel. I long to be back to me. Going to talk to my doctor about this.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Love this.  Lost 20 pounds this month.  Works best if I inject it in a fat fold vs middle of my stomach. Mild side effects nothing major.  Went down to 1200 cals a day easily without hunger pangs.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Mild diarrhea, loss of food craving weight loss  mild injection  site pain
Comments: Seems  to be working  great for me so far. I feel  a lot better already.
Name: VICTOZA

Comments: Immediaely dropped blood sugars from 140-160 (fasting) to 90-115 (fasting). in2 weeks. Amazing drug.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Mild nausea, stomach cramping, heartburn and headache. Severe diarrhea and fatigue
Comments: Symptoms subsided after about 4 weeks. I've lost 11 pounds so far. This is my 1st week symptom free so I'm anxious to see if the weightloss continues. I've been on 1,000mg of Metformin per day for about 2 years and my blood sugar began to get higher & higher. Victoza improved my sugar levels immediately.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Mild nauses and heartburn
Comments: Has helped control my appetite and decrease sugar craving
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: minor nausea 4 hours after shot for the first several weeks.  however, this stopped over time.
Comments: this has worked very well for me; was 50 lb overweight at 5'1" and could no longer reduce by regular methods. combined with strict dietary changes (low carb, no fruit/ added sugar/starches) and exercise, I lost 45 lb in less than 5 months. regained energy, prob due to weight loss and mild hormone therapy. No nausea, never had vomiting or diarrhea.  I will be transitioning off victoza (ramping down dosage now) and dr. expects I will be fine, perhaps may need metformin in future, but will see how it goes.  will keep dietary changes and exercise.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Mouth dry and diarrhea..
Name: VICTOZA

Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Nausea for the first few days got better, I loss 15 pounds in the first  two months, no additional weight loss.

But I tried it for a few more months went back for a follow up visit to find out I now have thyroid nodules scheduled for biopsy will never take this drug again, so angry at myself for going against my own judgement.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: nausea loss of appetite
Comments: Taken drug for one week by injection,Dr says it will lower my AC1 levels and I will lose weight waiting to see how well it works.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Nausea which went away after first 10 days, maybe fatique not sure if it is mistakes I have made in diet change.
Comments: This medication has changed my life along with a new very strict diet and joining a gym, which is somethimng i would not have been able to do before starting Victoza I am beginning to feel like the old me again!!!!!!
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Nausea, bloating, diarrhea, cramping, fatigue
Comments: My upper and lower GI side effects started a few hours after my first dose and have only intensified. I am nauseated all the time, and my stomach is tender and bloated.  I feel like I need to have a massive burp, but the little ones I can produce don't give any relief.   I have now learned that this med slows emptying of the stomach, so the symptoms make sense.  The thought of food makes me want to throw up; if you can't eat, then of course you're going to lose weight... this just isn't the way I want to do it, LOL.  I will not be continuing with Victoza, and pray that it won't take long for these symptoms to fade away.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Nausea, lathargic, diaherra
Comments: Not sure how much longer I can continue.  I had hoped I could lose some weight by taking it and get off diabetic med all together.  I feel bloated,  stomach unsettled.  Haven't been far from the bathroom since I started taking it.
Name: VICTOZA

Reason: To manage my BS w/o so many needles
Sideffects:
Nausea, then uncontrollable vomiting. Lost 10 pounds in 3
days.  Was never overweight. At almost 5'9" I weighed 160 lbs
before Victoza. Loss of appetite. The little I did eat came back up in full force. Initially when I was first diagnosed with  
diabetes type 2 I was taking Glipizide. In 2010 I was put on      insulin, both Levemir and Humalog. There was no problem except I got tired of sticking myself with needles and wanted to return to oral medication. That when I was prescribed Victoza and 750 mg of Metformin. I have to take 0.6 for a
week, 1.2 the 2nd week and 1.8 the 3rd week and thereafter.  I vomited a lot (and I mean a lot) but concluded
that maybe it was because of the levothyroxine and avorstatin medication.  When I stopped taking it, the vomiting stopped and I felt better. With all the negative hype
about the side effects, I worry and don't really know if I will continue taking Victoza and Metformin. The best thing is that I only have to stick myself 2x daily no
Comments:
I had been taking Levothyroxine for underactive thyroid and
Avorstatin for my cholesterol a long time and don't think Victoza
should be taken with these medications
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, muscle aches, migraine (usually not all at the same time, thankfully)
Comments: I started at loading dose of .6 for several days, then went up to 1.2 which was a bad idea because I got very ill with vomiting and diarrhea , also some muscle cramping in the backs of my legs and even got a terrible migraine. Backed down to .6 and symptoms left. Now I go up a click every few days, working my way up to my prescribed dose of 1.2. Currently on .9 dosage. I lost 10 pounds initially but have not lost any more weight even though I hardly eat at all, I'm just not hungry. I feel more energy than I have for a while so I am quite happy with the drug, but the cost is prohibitive.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Nauseus feeling first two days right after taking med, light headache,very mild stomach cramps first few days
Comments: I LOVE this med so far! I am taking it along with metaforim. I have been diabetic 2 for over 10 years and just the metaforim only was not working lately. The weight loss effect is an added plus! I have lost 9 lbs in 10 days! I started at .6 for a week and then upped it per doctor to 1.2  I have no appetite which is awesome! And I am getting my energy back!
Name: VICTOZA

Comments: really works predictably and well, though the first 2-3 weeks were tough. of course regulating your diet is extremely important, especially re fiber consumption. i'm so happy not to be taking metformin, which really didn't work for me, and also gave me very painful/unpredicatble stomach problems.

Sideffects: Severe gingival irritation was the main reason I stopped. Constipation was annoying, but not a deal-breaker. I noticed reduced efficacy of other medications, specifically my Lexapro.  Reduced my appetite somewhat, but my motivation to exercise was reduced as well, so it was a wash.
Comments: I was impressed by how painless the injections were.  Disappointed that it didn't work for me.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Severe headache that would not go away, sinus pain, severe back and shoulder pain, occasional abdominal pain, bloating stomach, foul burps and gas, extreme fatigue, brain fog, depressed mood.
Comments: My blood sugar did go down and appetite decreased.  But side effects were so severe that I could not function in my daily life.  Felt terrible, exhausted and disconnected from my life.  I'm also extremely concerned about the potential damage from this drug.  For me, this drug is not worth the problems it caused me.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: severe intestinal cramping and pain, severe flatulence, diarrhea, glands swelling, aggravated Hashimotos thyroiditis, caused A1C to INCREASE dramatically
Comments: Should be taken off the market
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Severe nausea and acid re flux like symptoms first 3 week with severe fatigue.   But well worth the pain now.
Comments:
Blood sugar before startin Victoza average 300 to 480 with taking 2 types of insulin 3 time a day. 
Blood sugar after starting Victoza on 06/09/2011 now averages 70 to 140.  Awesome.   
My weight on 06/09/2011 was 325.  Now after Victoza my weight is 246 as of 1201702011.   

I have seen concerns from many on here about thyroid cancer that was seen in lab rats .  Please note that the lab rats were given a dosage 10 times greater than the maximum human dose of 1.8.   

No tyroid cancer was seen in the ape study , and non have been reported by humans as of today.   

For me the benefits have outweighed the risk !     I will continue Victoza ..   Heaven sent for me.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Severe nausea, vomiting, no appetite, constipation 3+ days, lethargic,. Did not use 4th dose due to side-effects and woke up with half my tongue swollen to the roof of my mouth. Could only drink water. Clammy, sweaty, then freezing.
Comments: I do not think the side effects are worth any benefit I may get. Waiting to call doctor this am.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Severe nausea. Vomiting. Shaking. Blurred eyesight. Migraine.
Comments: I would never take it again
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Severe nausea; diarrhea; stomach pain.
Comments: I switched to Victoza from Janumet with hopes of achieving better HgA1C control (mine had been running approx 7.0-7.1).  At my first 3 month check up with my MD after the switch to Victoza, my A1C had risen to 7.7. I asked to stop the med since my quality of life was suffering (ex: constant N/D> immediately having to run to the bathroom after eating a meal). He asked me to continue taking Victoza for another 3 months to see if things improved.  The side effects seemed to improve somewhat; but I would still get occasional nausea and diarrhea, plus also these occasional sharp shooting pains and discomfort in my upper abdominal region. In addition, my weight increased by several pound.  At my next 3 month check up, my A1C had risen even higher to 8.5.  At that time, I asked my MD if we could stop it and and restart the Janumet. He agreed.   Victoza did not work for me at all.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Severe stomach issues including upper and lower digestive track. Was able to keep food down on 1.2 dosage but as soon as dosage was raised to 1.8, I was deathly sick. I will not be going back on it because I feel that it is poison to my body. Did loose 20 lbs in 6 weeks, but it was because I was only eating about 1000 cal. a day. Had no desire to eat, look at, or cook food. Had no energy at all and felt more depressed. It did lower my blood sugars, but as little as I was eating, it's no wonder.
Comments: I also experienced headaches and bloating the whole time I was on Victoza, even at the lowest dosage.
Name: VICTOZA

Takes a few days for body to settle down experienced all the symptoms mentioned by everyone. Lost weight  only mild side affects   On 1.8 now

Name: VICTOZA

Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: stomach issues , nausea and really sick stomach in the beginning.
Comments: I have lost 37 pounds in 3 months, the side effects are almost gone and my body is adjusting well to this in combination with1000 mg Metformin daily also. I am taking 1.2 of the Victoza and my BS is great and my A1C has gone from 9.6 to 7.2  and I am thrilled. I just turned 60 and I feel like this is giving me a second chance. I knew that I was on the brinko of disaster and I am so thankful for this medicine. I know it is not going to be for everyone, but don't give up so quickly. It has changed my life and I can't wait to loose another 20 lbs and stay healthy. Thank you researchers and doctors for this medicine. On the flip side I did not think I was going to be able to do this but as I said the sick stomach and fatique has subsided. Stick it out and let this work for you too.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Sulfa eggs burps horrible stomach aches diarrhea. Stomach pains gas
Comments: But my sugar when I am testing it has been in 110 range which before was in the 300 and Ive lost about 30lbs in a month which I can deal with the nasty side effects. I haven't been hungry at all have to force myself to have a couple bites of food and I and not craving sweets as I did badly before. I and mm pleased with how it's helped me so far and I pray I can continue to take without any bad side effects
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: the first day I experienced irregular heartbeat about 4 hours after the dose. This lasted till 5am the next day. I took magnesium and havent had that problem since. Day 3 I ate my "usual" amount for breakfast, and later was nauseated, and later had diarrhea, but when not eating my habitual amount I am fine. Today day 5 had a snack in the morning of cashews, and almonds, and about 45 min. later was shaking from low Blood Sugar. Still taking a low dose of Metaglip (metformin and glipizide) which "kicks" the pancreas to produce all day.  Hope to soon get off the glipizide. So far getting used to not wanting to eat as much. very excited about the results so far. minimal side effects!
Comments: I would recommend to try this drug. for me it has been great so far!
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: The first six weeks I had pain in my stomach. Mainly a pressure feeling in my stomach and lots of burping. That has now all stopped, and then I increased to 1.8, but was so dizzy, and sore throat. I dropped back to 1.2 and that solved the problem. The weight loss has been slow, but better then not taking it. I will give this more time.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: The first two weeks of this drug are hard. Start at 0.6 for a week and then go up 1 click a week (no more) to avoid severe symptoms of nausea. Forget about eating. Side effects are much less if a person is active and eats less.
Comments: This is a very effective and very strong diabetic medicine which is over-prescribed and causes most of the bad side effects because of too high a dose. I was very cautious in adding it, and through raising 1 click a week and checking bs 3 times a day and logging it found that 1.0mg 1x day brought my blood sugar under complete control with 2000mg of metformin which I intend to continue to take for insulin resistance. It allowed me to completely drop the 6mg of Glimeperide and while bringing my a1c from 7.8 to 6.2 after 15 years of being diabetic. I lost 23 lbs, and changed my eating habits to conform with the Victoza and have kept it off. Those who claim they have put it back on do not realize the appetite loss goes away and you have to monitor your food intake closely as well as exercise. This is not a miracle drug which will work for you if you lay on the couch and eat. That will create the side effects.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Tiredness, heart palpitations, bloatedness, eggy burping, stomach discomfort
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: to start the usual, sickness ,but now ive found that its causing major heartbeat probs when i try to do anything wich also makes me very breathless
Comments: this has got my sugars well down from 19/ 22 to 7/9 wich for me is brill as i do like my chocky and stuff but very anoyed of this effect that has accured now
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Tolerated Victoza at 1.2ML but 3 month A1C was not much better. Doctor raised dosage to 1.8 ML now have intestinal issues, BGL not much better and feel weak and tired all the time.
Comments: For the money this drug does not improve my diabetic life to a point a feel its worth the side effects, risks and improvement in A1C levels. I would not recommend to anyone who does not see big improvements within a few weeks and can tolerate the side effects.
Name: VICTOZA

Reason: To help with my type two diabetes
Sideffects: Very sick

Sideffects: Victoza worked great in lowering my blood sugar and A1c. I did have gastrointestinal side effects but they were manageable.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Violent vomiting every 3 days, constant burping, gas, stomach noises, rash at injection sites, food staying in stomach and rotting, bad breath, loss of appetite
Comments: Side effects diminishing after 1 month, NO weight loss, sugars coming down slowly
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Vomiting, nausea, extreme headaches
Comments: Although it is the first drug that has helped me be able to lose weight, the side effects are awful. I have been taking it 2 months and still manage to vomit at least 3 times a week. On the bright side, it does work and I have lost 15 lbs. Just rough side effects.
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: When you first start there is some nausea.  I did vomit a few times, but I guess that probably depends on your tolerance for nausea.   That is the only bad effects I have.
Comments: This drug has been wonderful.  I started taking it because even on Metformin my A1c was 9.2, fastings in the high 200s.  It was horrible, bad foot neuropathy etc.  There is some nausea when you first start taking this and I had it fairly bad for the first month probably, but there are things I learned to decrease it.  Smaller meals and I take the shot later in the day like a few hours after lunch.  The worst nausea occurred when I took it right after a meal...Don't do that!!!  It slows stomach emptying and if you take it right after your meal just sits there and causes issues.  I am over 350 pounds and in 3 months I've lost 35 pounds effortlessly. My A1c went from 9.2 to 6.5 in the first three months. I have been huge my whole life.  I have always felt like I was missing something that tells me when to stop eating....Victoza does that for me.  Now I will have a meal and eating along as normal and something will just tell me its enough and I stop with no problem.  I very rarely finish my plate now.  I have a stop button now and I stay full longer.  I no longer eat anything after dinner...no interest in it at all.  I also do not crave carbs like I use to.  Yes the side effects can be bad at first, but I can say with all honesty that now 4 months out and I do not have any side effects, but maybe rarely.  If you are big and your sugars are out of wack the side effects are worth it.  Just get through the first 2-4 weeks and be smart, don't stuff yourself especially at dinner.  Als
Name: VICTOZA

Sideffects: Within 3 weeks I dropped 25lbs. I had to go to hospital in April which I weighed 255lbs. A couple days after I weighed 260lb. I was recently at Dr on june23 and weighed 261.8. So looks like the usual with my body, it adapts to medicine quickly then doesnt work!Ive always been that way.
Comments: Now Im starting to have really bad eggy burps and flatulence!! Ugh
Name: VICTOZA

Comments: WAS JUST INFORMED BY MY WELLNESS NURSE AFTER STUDYING MORE ON THIS MED, THAT LONG TERM USE CAN CAUSE THYROID CANCER.
Name: VICTOZA

Comments:
LOVE THIS DRUG...NO SIDE AFFECTS AT ALL,IT HAS
WORKED FOR ME BETTER THEN ANY OTHER DIETS/MEDS
I HAVE EVER TAKEN...
I WAS SCEPTICAL TO USE AT FIRST BECAUSE OF ALL THE
NEGATIVE COMMENTS,HOWEVER IT HAS BEEN A TREMENDOUS DRUG FOR ME..........
THANKS VICTOZA I HAVE LOST 25# IN ONLY 28 DAYS
THE DOCTORS ARE PLEASED AND SO AM I....
